channel.title: CVE Feed for Lexmark -- Perceptive Document Filters
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Lexmark -- Perceptive Document Filters

item.title: CVE-2017-2821|2024-08-05T14:02:07.914Z -- lexmark -- perceptive%20document%20filters
item.description: An exploitable use-after-free exists in the PDF parsing functionality of Lexmark Perspective Document Filters 11.3.0.2400 and 11.4.0.2452. A crafted PDF document can lead to a use-after-free resulting in direct code execution.

item.title: CVE-2017-2822|2024-08-05T14:09:16.367Z -- lexmark -- perceptive%20document%20filters
item.description: An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the image rendering functionality of Lexmark Perceptive Document Filters 11.3.0.2400. A specifically crafted PDF can cause a function call on a corrupted DCTStream to occur, resulting in user controlled data being written to the stack. A maliciously crafted PDF file can be used to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-2806|2024-08-05T14:02:07.911Z -- lexmark -- perceptive%20document%20filters
item.description: An exploitable arbitrary read exists in the XLS parsing of the Lexmark Perspective Document Filters conversion functionality. A crafted XLS document can lead to a arbitrary read resulting in memory disclosure. The vulnerability was confirmed on versions 11.3.0.2228 and 11.3.0.2400
